biogHist.abstract: Care Leavers Australia Network (CLAN), founded in 2000 in Sydney, is a support and advocacy group for people brought up in care away from their family as state wards or Home children raised in Children's Homes, orphanages or other institutions, or in foster care. CLAN is also for anyone who has a close family member who was placed in 'care'. It was a strong advocate for Redress WA applicants when that scheme was operating in WA,and organized a number of rallies to protest about the reduction in redress payments and to advocate for more support services. The founding members of CLAN are Leonie Sheedy and Joanna Penglase, both 'care leavers' who had for years been involved in awareness-raising about the issues facing people who experienced out of home 'care' as children.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Redress Scheme Speech in House of Representatives by Steve Irons, MP

archref.unittitle: Redress Scheme Speech in House of Representatives by Steve Irons, MP
archref.abstract: In this speech in the Australian Parliament's House of Representatives, MP Steve Irons declared his support for Redress WA applicants and disappointment in the WA State Government's reduction in the maximum payment. He also says that people who have been in care would 'all prefer to be known as the Remembered Australians'.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Outcry at cut in abuse compo

archref.unittitle: Outcry at cut in abuse compo
archref.abstract: This article from The West Australian reports on the State Government's decision to reduce Redress WA payments which are 'almost halved'. According to the article, this was a 'shock move' and a 'huge blow to thousands of victims of State abuse'.
archref.physdesc: Digital version of a photocopy of article on page 6.

archref.abstract: This article from the The Perth Voice reports on a rally at Parliament House on 11 August 2009, organized by Care Leavers Australia Network (CLAN) to protest the State Government's decision to reduce the maximum payment under Redress WA.
archref.physdesc: Digital version of a photocopy of article on page 3.
